title: Watch: Firefighters in R.I. rescue yellow Lab who fell through the ice
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Local News Volunteers reported arriving within minutes and locating the dog struggling in the water, unable to move.
Firefighters rescue Phoenix, a yellow Lab that fell through the ice on New Year's Day in Rhode Island.

Misquamicut Fire Department A yellow Lab named Phoenix rose from the ashes — or at least the ice — after falling into a frozen pond in Rhode Island on New Year’s Day, necessitating an ice rescue from local firefighters.

title: 2 people dead after being pulled from water off of Martha’s Vineyard
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News Authorities have suggested the weather was to blame after a scalloping boat reportedly capsized near Edgartown Thursday.
By Abby Patkin January 2, 2026 | 11:26 AM 1 minute to read Two people are dead after they were pulled from the water off of Martha’s Vineyard Thursday, officials confirmed.

title: Man and woman found dead in Fairhaven home on New Year’s Eve
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The two were found inside a Jameson Street residence on Wednesday night, officials said.
A man and a woman were found dead inside a Fairhaven residence on New Year’s Eve, according to Bristol District Attorney Thomas Quinn’s office.
The victims were identified as Rafael Pedraza, 60, and Brenda Rosario, 51.

title: Kick off 2026 with these New England winter events

bullets: Scenic Six Skiing at night, free things to do in Boston, and more.

title: Take a break from scrolling at New Bedford’s 25-hour ‘Moby Dick’ marathon
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Books Some 2,500 people are expected at the 30th annual marathon reading of Melville’s classic — a ritual organizers call “cathartic and communal.

title: Patriots’ Week 2 win over the Dolphins was the start of a memorable season
author: Chad Finn
bullets: New England Patriots It’s fitting that the Patriots wrap up their remarkable regular season against the Dolphins, against whom they first showed flashes of excellence way back in Week 2.
Drake Maye (center) threw for 230 yards and two touchdowns and added another on the ground in the Patriots' Week 2 win over the Dolphins.
